title.narrative: 1. CHILD PROTECTION LEGAL FRAMEWORK

description.narrative: By 2022, the child protection authorities are better equipped to implement a political and legal framework around child protection at all levels., which contributes to Access To Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable girls and boys, especially those at risk of or affected by violence, exploitation and abuse, are better protected in their families and communities by institutions mandated for child protection and the society in general.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the child protection authorities are better equipped to implement a political and legal framework around child protectionat all levels.

description.narrative: As a result of UNICEF’s support, the Country participated in the global END VIOLENCE campaign and a declaration strengthening its investment in the protection of children against violence is under the Prime Minister’s signature. Forty-one children in conflict with the law (one girl) benefited from alternative measures to imprisonment, 271 ones (11 girls) are preparing for their social reintegration, and 61,623 unregistered children (30,680 girls) received their birth certificates. UNICEF provided support to operationalize the interoperability protocolsigned by the Ministry of Health and MATD; which enabled intersectoral collaboration (Social affairs, Health, Education and Civil Registration) for birth registration. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/01/2022
